perturbation.original_text: The Company has filed with the Commission a registration statement on Form S-3 (No. 333-208956) covering the registration of the Offered Shares under the Act, including a base prospectus (the "Base Prospectus"). Such registration statement, as amended, including the financial statements, exhibits and schedules thereto, in the form in which it became effective under the Act, including all documents incorporated or deemed to be incorporated by reference therein and any information deemed to be a part thereof at the time of effectiveness pursuant to Rule 430B under the Act, shall be referred to as the "Registration Statement."
perturbation.changed_text: The Company has filed with the Commission a registration statement on Form S-3 (No. 333-208956) covering the registration of the Offered Shares under the Act, including a base prospectus (the "Base Prospectus").  For the purposes of *Section 1, only*, Such registration statement, as amended, including the financial statements, exhibits and schedules thereto, in the form in which it became effective under the Act, including all documents incorporated or deemed to be incorporated by reference therein and any information deemed to be a part thereof at the time of effectiveness pursuant to Rule 430B under the Act, shall be referred to as the "Registration Statement."
perturbation.explanation: This change restricts the scope of the 'Registration Statement' definition to Section 1 only. This contradicts the implicit understanding that the term applies to the entire document, potentially creating uncertainty about which definition to apply in other sections.

perturbation.original_text: The Agent's aggregate fee for its services hereunder will be an amount equal to 3.15% of the gross proceeds from the sale of the Offered Shares sold to Purchasers that are not affiliates of the Agent (such fee payable by the Company at and subject to the consummation of Settlement).
perturbation.changed_text: The Agent's aggregate fee for its services hereunder will be an amount equal to 3.15% of the gross proceeds from the sale of the Offered Shares sold to Purchasers that are not affiliates of the Agent (such fee payable by the Company at and subject to the consummation of Settlement). *However, for all transactions after December 31, 2016, the Agent's fee will be 4.0% of gross proceeds.*
perturbation.explanation: The initial definition says the fee is 3.15%. The added text in the Section introduces another potential fee (4%) if a transaction is consummated after a specific date. This creates uncertainty as to which fee applies, particularly in transactions that start before and conclude after the specified date, or if the contract extends beyond that date, leading to conflict.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will use the net proceeds received in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares and will cause the Operating Partnership to use the net proceeds received in connection with the issuance and sale of the Company Preferred OP Units in the manner described in the "Use of Proceeds" section of the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, and, except as disclosed in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, the Company does not intend to use any of the proceeds from the sale of the Offered Shares hereunder to repay any outstanding debt owed to any affiliate of the Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will use the net proceeds received in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares and will cause the Operating Partnership to use the net proceeds received in connection with the issuance and sale of the Company Preferred OP Units in the manner described in the "Use of Proceeds" section of the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus. *Notwithstanding the above, the Company may, at its discretion, allocate up to 10% of the net proceeds towards general administrative expenses, irrespective of what is stated in the "Use of Proceeds" section.*, and, except as disclosed in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, the Company does not intend to use any of the proceeds from the sale of the Offered Shares hereunder to repay any outstanding debt owed to any affiliate of the Agent.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a conflict regarding the use of proceeds. Originally, the proceeds had to be used as described in the specified sections of the Registration Statement, General Disclosure Package, and Prospectus. The addition allows for a discretionary allocation of up to 10% for general administrative expenses, irrespective of those prior mentioned documents. This contradicts the initial commitment and creates uncertainty about how the net proceeds will be used, potentially violating investor expectations and leading to legal challenges over transparency.
